summary: Adds a series of five perks within the Block skill tree, tailored towards playing a character without any armour.
descriptionHtml:
Adds a series of five perks within the Block skill tree, tailored towards playing a character without any armour. Why Block? Well...

-Block allows you to level up the necessary skills and receive perks while not wearing heavy or light armour; which is exactly what this mod is for!

-Block means that you\'ll have to work pretty hard if you also want to use the defensive perks from mage skills to become totally unkillable.  

-You can run around the battlefield in nothing but a chef\'s hat!

You can start training in this perk tree as soon as you want; it does not have any Block prerequisites.

================
:::OTHER STUFF:::
================
If you want to dual wield weapons, that means you won\'t be able to block, and therefore cannot level up these perks, and that\'s terrible!  Therefore, I - and others - recommend Dual Wield Parrying, found here:  http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9247

I don\'t know that guy, he doesn\'t know me, but he sure did make a mod that eliminates a glaring flaw in mine!


The very helpful Kayem237 has created a version of this mod that works with SkyRe, if you\'re into that sort of thing.  Check it out over at:  http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23490

============
:::UPDATES:::
============
8-30-12

-Fixed an issue with Tempered Flesh not referencing the proper ability.


8-29-12

-Changed the way damage reduction is calculated to bring it in line with Skyrim\'s existing damage-reducing abilities. Should no longer give more damage reduction than is intended.

-Removed rank 5 of Tempered Flesh and Arcane Protection to compensate for some other damage reducing abilities. Max damage reduction is now 45%.

-Changed the way the perks interacted with other armours. Now no longer locks you out of the perk tree if heavy or light armour are over 30; bonuses will only apply when no armour is worn.

These changes come from me learning a good deal more about what exactly I was doing, but may still have some issues simply due to my inexperience. If you notice anything, please speak up and let me know, so I can try to fix it.

==================
:::KNOWN ISSUES:::
==================
-I\'ve been told that using this in conjunction with SkyRe makes the Shatter and Dispel SkyRe perks disappear, but you can re-enable them with the appropriate console commands.
author: Rekkin
